intro: Terminalia subcordata, commonly known as African snowball, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its clusters of white, fluffy flowers that resemble snowballs, blooming in spring. The plant has smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Terminalia subcordata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
